sources.title: Double Deal
sources.description: Tommy McCoy (Freddie Jackson) and "Dude" Markey (Monte Hawley) are both in love with Harlem singer/dancer Nita (Jeni Le Gon). Markey robs a jewelry store and turns the loot over to gang-boss Murray Howard (Maceo Bruce Scheffield). Later, Markey robs the safe, steals the jewelry, and, in order to get rid of his rival for Nita, frames the robbery on McCoy. The latter's big-brother thinks otherwise and, with Nita's help, sets out to prove it.

sources.title: Double Deal (1939) CRIME DRAMA
sources.description:
BLACK HISTORY MONTH
Stars: Monte Hawley, Jeni Le Gon, Edward Thompson 
Director: Arthur Dreifuss

Tommy McCoy and "Dude" Markey are both in love with Harlem singer.. Markey robs a jewelry store and turns the loot over to gang-boss Murray Howard, but later robs the safe, and frames the robbery on McCoy!

metadata.Plot: Tommy McCoy and "Dude" Markey are both in love with Harlem singer/dancer Nita. Markey robs a jewelry store and turns the loot over to gang-boss Murray Howard. Later, Markey robs the safe, steals the jewelry, and, in order to get rid of his rival for Nita, frames the robbery on McCoy. The latter's big-brother thinks otherwise and, with Nita's help, sets out to prove it.
